Almost all of the product tests don't include that step; should I add it throughout this file?
No never mind. Keep it as is. It does not matter much and code in finally can actually make it harder to debug test by masking the exception which caused original failure.
can you also add another test which inserts using hive (or extend this one)?

This sounds simple, but I'm running into some unusual issues with it—Hive seems to be insert all of 'null_value', null, and '\N' as null, which is not what I expected, and seems less-correct than the behavior for inserting from Presto. I'm not quite sure what to do about this.

It doesn't seem to work when you specify a format that respects serialization.null.format.
create table t3 (x string) stored as textfile tblproperties('serialization.null.format'='null_value');
insert into t3 values ('null_value'), ('\\N');
select * from t3;

+-------+--+
| t3.x  |
+-------+--+
| NULL  |
| NULL  |
+-------+--+

I'm thinking this isn't a Presto issue, so the solution is to test this a different way (e.g. making it an external table and using a static file, but that's hard except for textfile format, and the integration tests test that).
I tried to work around it in old Hive but I failed. The only idea I have is to guard this assertion with hive version. So we do not check it for old hive versions which seem buggy.

After thinking for a bit, I think the best solution is to just change the test to avoid this issue entirely, so I've just pushed that. It's a bug in Hive, not Presto, and Presto never saw anything wrong, so these tests cover Presto just as well. As an added benefit, the tests are a bit simpler now.
